content.user_title: Automate CI/CD pipelines and cloud infrastructure
content.value_statement: DevOps teams spend excessive time manually configuring pipelines and infrastructure. This skill provides automated tools for generating production-ready CI/CD pipelines, Terraform configurations, and deployment workflows across AWS, GCP, and Azure.
actual_capabilities: Generate CI/CD pipeline configurations for GitHub Actions and CircleCI
Create Terraform infrastructure templates for AWS, GCP, and Azure
Implement blue-green and canary deployment strategies
Configure Docker and Kubernetes deployment workflows
Analyze existing infrastructure and recommend improvements
Generate deployment reports and validation summaries
limitations: Does not execute deployments - only generates configurations
Does not access cloud credentials or live environments
Does not modify running infrastructure without explicit user approval
Requires user to apply generated Terraform/Pipeline files manually

use_cases.title: Generate production pipelines
use_cases.description: Create CI/CD pipelines with testing, security scans, and deployment stages for any tech stack.

use_cases.title: Standardize infrastructure code
use_cases.description: Generate consistent Terraform modules following organizational security and compliance standards.

use_cases.title: Audit deployment processes
use_cases.description: Analyze current deployment practices and receive recommendations for improvement.

prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a GitHub Actions CI/CD pipeline for a Node.js application with testing, building, and deployment stages.

prompt_templates.title: Infrastructure provisioning

prompt_templates.title: Deployment strategy
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate deployment manifests for a Kubernetes blue-green deployment with traffic switching and rollback automation.

prompt_templates.title: Full infrastructure audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze my current infrastructure setup and generate recommendations for improving reliability, security, and cost efficiency.

best_practices: Always review generated Terraform/Pipeline files before applying them to production environments
Store generated configurations in version control with proper PR review processes
Use the --verbose flag to understand what the skill is generating and why
anti_patterns: Running generated pipelines against production without first testing in staging environments
Committing generated files without reviewing the auto-generated security configurations
Using default settings for all infrastructure - always customize for your compliance requirements

faq.question: Does this skill deploy to my cloud accounts?
faq.answer: No. The skill generates configuration files only. You must review and apply them yourself.

faq.question: What cloud providers are supported?
faq.answer: AWS, GCP, and Azure are fully supported with Terraform configurations.

faq.question: Can I use this for existing infrastructure?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill can analyze current setups and generate improvement recommendations.

faq.question: Does this require credentials?
faq.answer: No credentials are needed. The skill generates configuration templates you apply with your own credentials.

faq.question: Can I customize the generated pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes. All generated files are templates you can modify to match your requirements.

faq.question: Is Kubernetes deployment supported?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill generates Kubernetes manifests and Helm charts for container deployments.
